018package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client;
019
020import org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration;
021import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseClassTestRule;
022import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.CoprocessorHost;
023import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.MultiRowMutationEndpoint;
024import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.NoOpScanPolicyObserver;
025import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.testclassification.LargeTests;
026import org.junit.Before;
027import org.junit.ClassRule;
028import org.junit.experimental.categories.Category;
029
030/**
031 * Test all {@link Increment} client operations with a coprocessor that just implements the default
032 * flush/compact/scan policy. This test takes a long time. The test it derives from is parameterized
033 * so we run through both options of the test.
034 */
035@Category(LargeTests.class)
036public class TestIncrementFromClientSideWithCoprocessor extends TestIncrementsFromClientSide {
037
038  @ClassRule
039  public static final HBaseClassTestRule CLASS_RULE =
040    HBaseClassTestRule.forClass(TestIncrementFromClientSideWithCoprocessor.class);
041
042  @Before
043  public void before() throws Exception {
044    Configuration conf = TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration();
045    conf.setStrings(CoprocessorHost.REGION_COPROCESSOR_CONF_KEY,
046      MultiRowMutationEndpoint.class.getName(), NoOpScanPolicyObserver.class.getName());
047  }
048}
